text:
When you are young and you see things that don’t seem right, like a large group getting turned away from a restaurant you worked at… you don’t really understand.  As time marches on, you learn more and you think back upon old instances with new insights. It’s an imperfect methodology, memory is not exact… and the levels of circumstance are
More than you could have even known then and certainly not upon reflection.  

But, what it also does… it creates a better awareness of working better.  We are at a place in human history where youth and older generations need to find places of interaction of work within and beyond the various spheres of influence we exist within and are moving toward.  

This may seem small but it’s not.  The work of health interoperability and infrastructure… it’s more than that, but it’s also true it’s not.  

When hurricane funds have a hard time finding application or policies and the webs of regulations make school updated more challenging… something’s amiss. But, it’s not government that’s the issue… it not the regulation, it’s the process of change management in very complex circumstance.   

The space to work can help, but it’s not a panacea.  And, we need to be thankful it’s not that simple… hate moves quickly.  

So many things y’all.
author: Ryan Weaver

text:
I came across this song quite by chance today, but I am a regular poster on the subject of divinity and inspiration in popular songs. This one mostly lacks those elements, I am sad to say (it is no "The Way it is" by Bruce Hornsby, which definitely has a touch of the Holy Spirit in it). Nevertheless, this song is pleasant enough and has meaningful content - especially as regards pointless wars of the past (as opposed to the present one with all its good-evil finality and clarity) and as regards the refusal of the mainstream media to address certain issues (whichever side they may pretend to be on). However, the endless repetition of "waiting" - the main point of it, after all - is wearing in the extreme in its passivity and conviction as to lack of agency. 

And given that Mayer's "generation" is people born in 1977, while the song is from 2006, the idea that he might still be waiting is scary indeed.

Let us DO SOMETHING! 

And, whether it is the War or other injustices, one thing we can do at ANY MOMENT - without any hesitation and waiting at all - is get down on our knees and pray to Father, Son and Paraclete. They are indeed WAITING ... for us. For a start, this is PRECISELY what we should do in regard to the War in Ukraine, as that is a clear good-and-evil situation, which is not going to be solved (at least not solved properly) by politics. 

In addressing key content of John Mayer's song, we can note that God does NOT misunderstand people, does not play down their importance or trivialise their contribution, even as - through the Holy Spirit and our own searching for our purpose in life, God offers us chances to act, to change things, to heal things - in each case in the direction of connectivity, unity, meaning, truth and love. 

That is not a little, but a very great deal indeed.
author: Sid Pheasant
